thread.title: A GED Does Not Make You a Loser - 25 Celebritie...
thread.title_full: A GED Does Not Make You a Loser - 25 Celebritie...

title: A GED Does Not Make You a Loser - 25 Celebritie...

organizations.name: christian slater - fotos international - getty images entertainment

text:
25 Celebrity Dropouts Who Earned a GED, List No. 1 You, too, can be successful with a GED. Sign Up for Our Free Newsletters Thanks, You're in! Health Tip of the Day Recipe of the Day There was an error. Please try again. Please select a newsletter. Please enter a valid email address. Did you mean ? Share Your Experience, Advice, Suggestions, and Stories with Others Updated August 08, 2016 . 
A lot of people think high school dropouts are losers. Not true! There are many, many valid reasons people don't finish high school in the "regular" way. 
Here is our growing list of celebrity dropouts who earned a GED. If these people can be successful with a GED, so can you! 
We strive to be accurate here. If you see a mistake, please comment! LOS ANGELES - NOVEMBER 2: Actor Christian Slater talks at the Regent Beverly Wilshire Hotel on November 2, 2006 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Piyal Hosain/Fotos International/Getty Images). Christian Slater - Fotos International - Getty Images Entertainment - GettyImages-72422009 1. Christian Slater 
Donald Deane wrote for Huffpost TV : "Christian Slater, star of ABC's 'The Forgotten,' appeared on 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show' and discussed his decision to go back to school and get his GED as a way to show his children the importance of a good education." 
"I was working from the time I was nine years old. So, school was not very important to me; it wasn't a great priority," Slater said. "And then, when I had kids, I want them to obviously get a full education ... I didn't want to lose the argument. So, I figured the best thing to do is to go and at least take some action, get the GED." 
Image: LOS ANGELES - NOVEMBER 2: Actor Christian Slater talks at the Regent Beverly Wilshire Hotel on November 2, 2006 in Los Angeles, California. (Photo by Piyal Hosain/Fotos International/Getty Images) 
continue reading below our video What are the Seven Wonders of the World WASHINGTON, DC - NOVEMBER 11: Bill Cosby speaks onstage at the Thurgood Marshall College Fund 25th Awards Gala on November 11, 2013 in Washington City. (Photo by Larry French/Getty Images for Thurgood Marshall College Fund). Larry French - Getty Images Entertainment 187717371 2. Bill Cosby 
Bill Cosby has had some negative press recently. It doesn't change the fact that he went far on a GED. 
A lengthy bio of Bill Cosby at Biography.com , includes these passages: More interested in sports than academics, Cosby played on his school's track and football teams. He was placed in a high school for gifted students after scoring high on an IQ test. But Cosby failed to apply himself, and ended up falling behind in his classes. He switched to Germantown High School, and even there he learned that he would have to repeat a grade. In frustration, Cosby dropped out. He worked several odd jobs before joining the U.S. Navy in 1956. ... Regretting his decision to drop out of school, Cosby earned his high school equivalency diploma while in the service. 
Image: WASHINGTON, DC - NOVEMBER 11: Bill Cosby speaks onstage at the Thurgood Marshall College Fund 25th Awards Gala on November 11, 2013 in Washington City. (Photo by Larry French/Getty Images for Thurgood Marshall College Fund) NEW YORK - NOVEMBER 11: L-R: Actor Michael J. Fox and wife actress Tracy Pollan pose with singer Sheryl Crow and Muhammad Ali at 'A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To Cure Parkinson's' benefit gala at the Waldorf-Astoria, November 11, 2006 in New York City. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Getty Images). Michael J Fox - Evan Agostini - Getty Images Entertainment - GettyImages-72510384 3. Michael J. Fox 
MichaelJFoxdatabase.com has this to say about Fox's education: "Although Michael was close to finishing high school, he decided to light out for Hollywood, California, USA to pursue his career. It was decided that Michael would leave after his 18th birthday, but before graduating High School . (Michael would not receive his General Equivalency Diploma until 1995.) His father drove him to Los Angeles and gave him $3,000 to get started." 
Read more about Michael J. Fox from Josh Bell. 
Image: NEW YORK - NOVEMBER 11: L-R: Actor Michael J. Fox and wife actress Tracy Pollan pose with singer Sheryl Crow and Muhammad Ali at 'A Funny Thing Happened On The Way To Cure Parkinson's' benefit gala at the Waldorf-Astoria, November 11, 2006 in New York City. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Getty Images) SAN DIEGO - JULY 22: Nicolas Cage attends the 2006 Comic-Con held on July 22, 2006 in San Diego, California. (Photo by Mark Davis/Getty Images). Nicholas Cage - Mark Davis - Getty Images Entertainment - GettyImages-71504440 4. Nicholas Cage 
NicholasCage.net says this about Nicholas Cage: "He hated school and ended up getting his GED." 
Image: SAN DIEGO - JULY 22: Nicolas Cage attends the 2006 Comic-Con held on July 22, 2006 in San Diego, California. (Photo by Mark Davis/Getty Images) DETROIT - MAY 14: Rap artist Eminem speaks about his financial past and present at the 1st Financial Hip Hop Summit May 14, 2005 in Detroit, Michigan. The summit, which brought together Russell Simmons and hip Hop and Rap artists to raise awareness of young adults about the importance of financial empowerment. (Photo by Bill Pugliano/Getty Images). Eminem - Bill Pugliano - Getty Images Entertainment - GettyImages-52825193 5. Eminem 
Eminem's bio at Biography.com includes this paragraph: Eminem attended Lincoln High School in Warren, Michigan, where he failed the ninth grade three times and eventually dropped out at the age of 17. Despite being a poor student, Eminem always had a deep affinity for language, devouring comic books and even studying the dictionary. "I found that no matter how bad I was at school, like, and no matter how low my grades might have been at some times, I always was good at English ... I just felt like I wanna be able to have all of these words at my disposal, in my vocabulary at all times whenever I need to pull 'em out." 
Although there are references on the Internet to Eminem's efforts to earn a GED, I couldn't find a definite source. 
Image: DETROIT - MAY 14: Rap artist Eminem speaks about his financial past and present at the 1st Financial Hip Hop Summit May 14, 2005 in Detroit, Michigan. The summit, which brought together Russell Simmons and hip Hop and Rap artists to raise awareness of young adults about the importance of financial empowerment. (Photo by Bill Pugliano/Getty Images) NEW YORK - JULY 14: Actress Christina Applegate makes an appearance at FYE to sign copies of the new 'Sweet Charity' CD on July 14, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Peter Kramer/Getty Images). Christina Applegate - Peter Kramer - Getty Images Entertainment - GettyImages-53238794 6. Christina Applegate 
A trivia item in IMDb's biography of Christina Applegate states, " Passed the GED with flying colors toward the end of her Junior year." 
More on Christina Applegate from Diana Mimon. 
Image: NEW YORK - JULY 14: Actress Christina Applegate makes an appearance at FYE to sign copies of the new 'Sweet Charity' CD on July 14, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Peter Kramer/Getty Images) NEW YORK - JUNE 20: American Idol runner-up Bo Bice performs on the NBC Today Show June 20, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Getty Images). Bo Bice - Evan Agostini - Getty Images Entertainment - GettyImages-53106464 7. Bo Bice 
Craig Spychalla of Capital Newspapers wrote this about Bo Bice for the Portage Daily Register : 
"...He tried enrolling himself, but was stopped by a staff member at the school and questioned about his rocker looks with long hair and piercings. 
"This guy says, "Excuse me. Where are you going?' I said, ‘I'm going to enroll in school. He said, ‘Not looking like that you're not. Cut your hair, take your earrings out, get that shirt tucked in and you come back tomorrow.'" 
"The long and short of it, I did not end up finishing school, but I got my GED," Bice said. 
More on Bo Bice from Bill Lamb. 
Image: NEW YORK - JUNE 20: American Idol runner-up Bo Bice performs on the NBC Today Show June 20, 2005 in New York City. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Getty Images) NEWPORT, ENGLAND - JUNE 13: David Bowie performs on stage on the third and final day of 'The Nokia Isle of Wight Festival 2004' at Seaclose Park, on June 13, 2004 in Newport, UK. The third annual rock festival takes place during the Isle of Wight Festival which runs from June 4-19. (Photo by Jo Hale/Getty Images). David Bowie - Jo Hale - Getty Images Entertainment - GettyImages-50958290 8. David Bowie 
You will find David Bowie's name on lists of GED celebrities, but I can't find a good source. If you can help, leave a comment. 
Read about David Bowie at Classic Rock with Dave White. 
Image: NEWPORT, ENGLAND - JUNE 13: David Bowie performs on stage on the third and final day of 'The Nokia Isle of Wight Festival 2004' at Seaclose Park, on June 13, 2004 in Newport, UK. The third annual rock festival takes place during the Isle of Wight Festival which runs from June 4-19. (Photo by Jo Hale/Getty Images) Curtis '50 Cent' Jackson at the 2006 Cannes Film Festival - 'Home of the Brave' Photocall at in Cannes. (Photo by David Lodge/FilmMagic). 50 Cent - David Lodge - FilmMagic - GettyImages-74799476 9. 50 Cent 
50CentNews.com includes this bit under Education in its profile of 50 Cent: "Andrew Jackson High School, expelled in 10th grade for possession of crack. Got his GED while in jail." 
Read more about 50 Cent from Henry Adaso. 
Image: Curtis '50 Cent' Jackson at the 2006 Cannes Film Festival - 'Home of the Brave' Photocall at in Cannes. (Photo by David Lodge/FilmMagic) LAS VEGAS - JULY 15: Daniel Ponce De Leon raises his arms as he stands with Bernard Hopkins (L), Marco Antonio Barrera and Oscar De La Hoya (R) of Golden Boy Promotions after knocking out Sod Looknongyangtoy in the first round of the WBO junior featherweight world championship fight to retain his title at the MGM Grand Garden Arena July 15, 2006 in Las Vegas, Nevada. (Photo by Ethan Miller/Getty Images). Oscar de la Hoya - Ethan Miller - Getty Images Sport - GettyImages-71456236 10. Oscar de la Hoya 
At JockBio.com , boxer Oscar de la Hoya's education is referred to in this paragraph: "His boxing schedule became so busy that eventually his family had to hire a tutor to help him with all the school he missed. Formal education, however, was of secondary importance." 
Read about Oscar de la Hoya from Andrew Eisele. 
Image: LAS VEGAS - JULY 15: Daniel Ponce De Leon raises his arms as he stands with Bernard Hopkins (L), Marco Antonio Barrera and Oscar De La Hoya (R) of Golden Boy Promotions after knocking out Sod Looknongyangtoy in the first round of the WBO junior featherweight world championship fight to retain his title at the MGM Grand Garden Arena July 15, 2006 in Las Vegas, Nevada. (Photo by Ethan Miller/Getty Images) Prev
